page.title: 04Flora - Broxwood Area
page.content:
This is a very rich area for wild flowers and over 50 varieties have been noted locally - the most common being primroses, wild daffodils and cow parsley.
The trees are mainly oak, ash, willow and chestnut and in the small woods spruce is planted. The hedgerow trees include holly, hazel, dogwood, hawthorn, blackthorn (otherwise known as sloe), goatwillow, ash, oak and elderberry. Honeysuckle, old man's beard (wild clematis) and bramble abound, and it is possible to see mistletoe growing on trees in orchards. Unfortunately all the elms have been killed by Dutch elm disease in the last few years.
